definition: half doubting/dubious/skeptical
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to doubt/to suspect

sentences.english: Su Chu overseas with a grain of salt, also dont want to accept such as the sword of kindness.
sentences.chinese: 苏楚侨半信半疑，也不愿接受兰如剑的好意。

sentences.english: The advertisement sounds too boastful to be convincing.
sentences.chinese: 这广告吹得太玄，使人不免半信半疑。

sentences.english: These words aroused the king's suspicions.
Oh, that thing yesterday. I been half thinking it was.
sentences.chinese: 欧，就是昨天那件事，我刚才还半信半疑那是个梦。

sentences.english: The demon master caught the gift and studied it dubiously .
sentences.chinese: 魔主拿住了礼物，又半信半疑地看了看它。
而一些人类专家却对此半信半疑。

sentences.english: I have suspected it some time, but I am now convinced.
sentences.chinese: 以前我不过半信半疑，现在我可完全相信了。
我对这个消息半信半疑。

definition: half believing, half doubting/skeptical
to believe firmly without any doubt (idiom)/absolute certainty about sth
suspicious/in doubt
to feel puzzled
to be at a loss (idiom)
not to understand the situation/unaware of the ins and outs
to be confused/to be baffled
to take sth to be true
unwilling to give up/unresigned
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
(idiom) half true and half false
see 煞有介事[sha4 you3 jie4 shi4]
absolutely true (idiom)/manifold/true from many points of view
decline to comment/not express an opinion/be noncommittal/hedge
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
see 百思不解[bai3 si1 bu4 jie3]
pinyin: bai3 si1 bu4 de2 qi2 jie3
